metadata.titel_preek: The Way of Glory: The Sermon on the Mount

primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God manifests His glory by justifying the ungodly and enabling a new way of life (the Sermon on the Mount) through union with Christ (the Vine).

tekstueel_bewijs: This reckoning is the work of God alone.
The power of his glory that can overcome every obstacle.
He is able to change water into fine wine with a word.

object.identificatie: Justification and the 'Embodied Enactment' of the Way of God
tekstueel_bewijs: God’s free gift of justifying faith
a summons to be an embodied enactment of the Way of God
The power of the God who calls sinners to righteousness
His gift to all who love him
the disciples of Jesus participate in his glory in spite of themselves

tegenstander.identificatie: Sin, The Great Adversary, and Human Pretension
tekstueel_bewijs: the great adversary will be pulling in the other direction
fallen human nature being as wayward and corrupt as it is
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is described as an ontological force ('fallen human nature') and a personal force ('the great adversary') that only divine power can overcome.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The community of believers living out the Sermon on the Mount as a witness to the world.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Church (e.g., Bruderhof)
secundair_narratief_programma.object: A rich and sustainable life of shared righteousness
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The secondary program (ethics) is explicitly framed as a 'result, not a cause' of the primary program (justification).

actantieel_schema_visualisatie.helper_subject_tegenstander: The Holy Spirit → Jesus Christ → Sin/Death

voorbeelden_god_subject: The Lord of creation is victor.
voorbeelden_mens_subject: The ordinary Christian takes the Sermon on the Mount...

voorbeelden: The preaching should never sound prescriptive.
Those who love him and seek to follow him.
How well does the average churchgoer even know it?
The power of his glory that can overcome every obstacle.
Apart from me you can do nothing.

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses almost entirely on 'Ability' (Grace as Power) rather than 'Obligation' (Law). It assumes the 'Devoir' is impossible without the 'Pouvoir' granted by the Vine.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: Moves from S2 (the weight of the Sermon) to ~S2 (reckoning/logizomai) to S1 (the gift of the Vine).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension is resolved by Christ being the only one who fulfilled the Sermon, now living it through the believer.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: High; the 'impossible' nature of the law is used to drive the subject to the necessity of grace.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon rigorously maintains God as the primary Actant. It explicitly warns against moralism and 'prescriptive' reading.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: The Bruderhof is proof that the Sermon on the Mount can actually be lived.

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: His was a life led entirely for others, in a way that no other human being has ever been able to do.
The preaching should never sound prescriptive.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: The Bruderhof is used as a 'proof of concept', but the author carefully attributes their success to the 'power of the vine'.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: The text already provides a theocentric reading: it is God's work in them.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief from the 'burden of impossibility' and empowerment through union with Christ.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Monergistic justification leading to synergistic sanctification.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from the 'Primary Program' (Justification) to the 'Secondary Program' (Community Life) is logically and theologically tight.
spanning_punten: The tension between James and Paul is addressed but remains a 'seeming contradiction'.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: the ultimate exchange—'the righteous for the unrighteous'

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Severe; described as an 'obstacle' that makes the Sermon 'humanly impossible'.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon successfully positions God as the Subject of salvation and the enabler of ethics.

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Maintain current balance; it serves the 'Grace' focus well.
modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Ensure the 'Vouloir' (Willingness) of the hearer is seen as a gift of the Spirit as well.

tegenstander_intensivering.huidige_status: Strongly defined as Sin and the Adversary.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: This is a masterclass in avoiding the 'moralistic trap' of the Sermon on the Mount by keeping Christ as the primary Actant.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: Rhetorical analysis would focus on the O'Connor/Lischer illustrations; Greimas shows these are actantial 'Helpers' for the Subject (God).
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis explains the Greek 'logizomai'; Greimas shows how 'logizomai' functions as a modal transformation of the Receiver.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that the 'glory' of the sermon is not a quality of the text, but the power of the Sender (God) flowing to the Receiver.

appendices.notities: The sermon uses the 'Vine and Branches' metaphor to perfectly bridge the gap between the Primary and Secondary programs.
